author: harithk
content:
from etherscan's perspective we'll want to index and have a dedicated label and dedicated page for displaying withdrawals on the execution layer

- a special txtype is ideal for us
- alternatively, it could be done as part of an 'internal transaction' and sent from a specific contract
- eip 4895 operations work too as long as the withdrawals are returned via RPC calls

but as long as there is a clear indication we'll be good - will do everything we can to support

author: harithk
content: wondering if there's inspiration to be found in how bridges handle cross-chain details with their balance transfers

author: sky.cactus
content: If it is a special system transaction then most likely it would be a new array of things on the block.

author: sky.cactus
content: When processing a block, you would iterate over that array and process them as appropriate (in this case updating recipient balances and whatnot).

author: sky.cactus
content: This list would, presumably, be returned when you query for the block via JSON-RPC.
